Name: Perchloroethylene Dry Clening Equipment, Removal
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to amending the building code to prohibit the installation and to require the removal of perchloroethylene-based dry cleaning equipment in certain residential occupancies.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

    	Section 1.  Section 27-252 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended to read as follows:
    	�27-252 Location restrictions.  a.  No space classified in industrial group D shall be located above the second story of any building or building section classified in construction group II containing a space classified in occupancy group J-1 or J-2.
    	b. (i)  Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the installation of perchloroethylene-based dry cleaning equipment shall be prohibited from any building containing a space classified in occupancy group J-1 or J-2.
	(ii)  Notwithstanding any other provision of law, all perchloroethylene-based dry cleaning equipment shall be removed from any building containing a space classified in occupancy group J-1 or J-2. 
    	�2. This local law shall take effect six months after its enactment into law, except that paragraph (ii) of subdivision b of section 27-252 of the administrative code as added by this local law shall take effect twenty-four months after its enactment into law. 
	Referred to the Committee on Housing and Building.
5/15/96LS #2372
